strip.back_to_map.title: Back to Fire Map
lead.1: P7CO® EcoResupply aims to democratize access to critical environmental information, with accuracy and transparency.
lead.2: The Fire Map shows, in near real time, the active occurrences in Portugal (mainland and islands), based on public data.
note.origin.primary: Primary source: Fogos.pt (citizen platform) which aggregates the official data from ANEPC.
note.update: Automatic update: periodic cycles; the lag clock reflects the latency ANEPC → Fogos.pt → P7CO.
note.geo: Approximate geolocation: coordinates may be generalized/anonimized at source for safety.
emerg.title: Severe fire: essential guidelines
emerg.immediate: Immediate danger: Move quickly away from fire fronts. Always follow local authority instructions and do not return to homes or land at risk. Official information.
emerg.alert: Alert/report: If you spot a fire, immediately call 112. You may also contact the GNR or the local fire brigade.
emerg.evac: Evacuation: Follow all evacuation warnings issued by ANEPC / Civil Protection. Leave calmly and orderly, helping elderly or mobility-impaired neighbors.
emerg.trapped: If trapped by fire: Seek already burnt areas or open spaces without vegetation. Protect yourself with cotton clothing, keep low to avoid inhaling smoke, and cover nose and mouth with a damp cloth.
emerg.smoke: Smoke and health: Avoid physical exertion in dense smoke. Keep doors and windows closed at home to reduce particle entry. In case of respiratory symptoms call SNS 24 (808 24 24 24). Directorate-General of Health.
emerg.vulnerable: Vulnerable groups: Children, the elderly, pregnant women and people with respiratory or heart diseases should be given priority protection and evacuated from smoke-affected areas.
emerg.info: Reliable information: Consult only official sources: ANEPC, IPMA, local radios or authority statements. Be wary of social media rumors.
emerg.foot: These guidelines are reproduced from official sources (ANEPC, DGS, GNR, IPMA, ePortugal). Always check the latest information from the competent authorities.
vost.title: VOST vs. Copernicus — rules, styles and semantics
vost.lead: VOST is always Area of Interest (AOI) — never “Delineation”. Polygons display only area popups (badge per source), and the pins remain official ANEPC/Fogos.pt (no VOST info on the pin).
vost.popup: Popup (areas only): blue badge for Copernicus, red for VOST, metrics (area, perimeter, radius), date (if in KML), and note “approximate values”.
vost.pins: Pins: “Ongoing” uses flame icon; other statuses use soft dot (official data only).
